Six years ago today, when 20 children and 6 teachers were gunned down at Sandy Hook Elementary School, I thought this is it, this is as low as we go. This is when we finally start to address the epidemic of gun violence. Sadly, that wasn’t the case and shootings have continued.

Six years ago, 20 children and 6 adults were killed at #SandyHook Elementary School. Today, we remember and honor their lives and pledge to do better. 

Six years should have been enough time for us to act to prevent gun violence.

And the toll of guns has increased since Sandy Hook, not decreased. Almost 40,000 Americans now die annually from guns, including suicides, murders and accidents. We can't eliminate those deaths, but a serious effort could perhaps reduce gun deaths by 10,000 a year. Let's try. https://t.co/ArGbE9WGkQ

We’re also teaching Americans about responsible gun storage to help protect children from unintentional shootings and gun suicide through https://t.co/cShDhHepi9. We’ve given thousands of presentations and partnered with the PTA and other organizations. #BeSmart
